alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 4:29AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Areas of Fog Have Spread Into Areas Northwest of I-4... At 428 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed fog spreading across Lake, northern Seminole and northwestern Volusia Counties. Visibilities in some areas had dropped to a few hundred yards or less. Fog is expected to continue spreading south and reach the I-4 corridor from Daytona Beach to the Greater Sanford and Orlando areas through sunrise. Should dense fog become more widespread, then a Dense Fog Advisory will be needed. The fog should burn off between 8 and 9 AM. Drivers should prepare to encounter rapid reductions in visibility on their morning commute. Consider leaving early so that you can arrive safely at your destination as a safe driving speed. When driving in dense fog, slow down, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County
